job description:
TerraGraphics Environmental Engineering, Inc. seeks qualified Environmental Scientist candidates for an air permitting and dispersion modeling position. The successful candidates will be self-motivated, organized, and detail-oriented individuals who can work well on a team and independently in a fast-paced environment. Qualified applicants to this position will be evaluated for full-time work based out of our Pasco office with work occurring at the DOE Hanford site.

Responsibilities Include:

Project work will involve providing environmental compliance and technical support as needed, in support of Hanford Site air operating permit requirements and a Hanford Site air emission program and modeling of near and far field air emissions.

Other potential tasks are:
  • Assist in development, revision, and review of Air Emission Permits
  • Development and coordination of necessary information and data requested by regulatory agencies, and negotiation with agencies as needed
  • Perform and document modeling of radioactive and non-radioactive air pollutants in the near field from vapor emissions resulting from the extension of stacks
  • Develop, revise, and review calculations documenting radioactive air and vapor emissions and impacts in the near field
  • Review and evaluate air emissions related data associated with stack sampling and monitoring, IH samples, near-facility air monitoring
Required Qualifications:
  • BS/BA in environmental science, engineering or closely related field
  • 1-10 years work experience relevant to federal and DOE air quality and permitting, RCRA, and waste management
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong technical writing skills
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Valid driver’s license with insurable driving record
Desired Qualifications:
  • Prior consulting experience
  • Working experience with AERMOD dispersion modeling by Breeze software
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite including Access, Excel, and Word
  • Hanford Site experience
